medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The discomfort began the previous day after being hit in the chest during karate. It was described as deep retro-sternal discomfort that was relatively mild, nonradiating, and non-pleuritic. The pain intensified over the ensuing hours and led to several episodes of lightheadedness that prompted medical attention.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Cosmetic surgery for pectus excavatum several years ago and several subluxations of the knee joints during sports.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother and grandmother both died suddenly of arterial dissection at age 29.
